comments:
I wasn't sure whether I should log this as JDT or SWT, but I figured I'd log it from the end-user 
perspective and just let you reassign if it's wrong :)

I can't nail down exactly when this happens, but it seems to only occur on newly created files.  Once 
this error happens, I can't actually click the "OK" on the error dialog to make it go away, though I can 'x' 
the error dialog window and then save, but the editor is subsequently dead -- I have to close it and 
reopen it for it to come back to life.  I wish I had a nice reproducible case for you, but it does happen 
rather often for me.  I'm invoking the organize imports call via the keystroke if that helps at all.

Exception seems to come from the OverviewRuler

Which build?
Any other plug-ins installed?
Next time when it happens please attach a screen shot that includes the full
workbench window and if possible the file that triggered the error.

see also:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-text-home/development/bug-incomplete.htm

The build is 3.1.1 final (M20050929-0840) and one very notable fact is that it's running as a nested editor 
inside a MultiEditor as part of the WOLips WO Component Editor plugin ( http://objectstyle.org/
confluence/display/WOL/Home )

Created an attachment (id=28078)
screenshot after error happens
Please file the bug against WOLips WO Component Editor plugin

There's nothing of WOLips in this stack trace -- It's a Java Editor as one component of a MultiEditor, so it 
appears to be a bug with this particular scenario which WOLips just happens to use rather than an actual 
bug in WOLips.

The Java editor is internal code and not designed to be inside a multi-page
editor  and we have no idea how the internal code is used.

Not sure if it changes anything, but it's actually inside of a org.eclipse.ui.part.MultiEditor as opposed to a 
org.eclipse.ui.part.MultiPageEditor.  So Java Editor as one editor in a MultiEditor is not a supported 
scenario?

The Java editor is not API i.e. any use outside JDT UI is possible but not
supported.
